riddle: It walks on four legs in the morning, two legs at noon and three legs in the evening. What is it?
I am the beginning of the end, and the end of time and space. I am essential to creation, and I surround every place. What am I?
What always runs but never walks, often murmurs, never talks, has a bed but never sleeps, has a mouth but never eats?
I never was, am always to be. No one ever saw me, nor ever will. And yet I am the confidence of all, To live and breathe on this terrestrial ball. What am I?
At night they come without being fetched. By day they are lost without being stolen. What are they?
What is in seasons, seconds, centuries and minutes but not in decades, years or days?
The one who makes it, sells it. The one who buys it, never uses it. The one that uses it never knows that he’s using it. What is it?
The more you have of it, the less you see. What is it?
What smells like purple paint, tastes like green paint, and can appear as a white dove?
This thing all things devours: Birds, beasts, trees, flowers; Gnaws iron, bites steel; Grinds hard stones to meal; Slays king, ruins town, And beats high mountain down
What has roots as nobody sees, Is taller than trees Up, up it goes, And yet never grows?
What word starts with 'e' and ends with 'e' but often has only one letter in it?
My first's possessed by all mankind,My second skims the wave; My whole will dash through wave and wind. In hopes my first to save. Who am I?
Alive without breath, As cold as death; Never thirsty, ever drinking, All in mail never clinking
We are two brothers on opposite sides of the road, but we never see each other. Who are we?
This both describes gorgeous woman and an excellent punch.
It's shorter than the rest, but when you're happy, you raise it up like it's the best. What is it?
I have a head, tail, but no arms and legs. What am I?
My life is measured in hours. I serve by being devoured. Thin, I am quick; Fat, I am slow. Wind is my foe. What am I?
There is one in every corner and two in every room.
A man says: Brothers and sisters, have I none, but that man's father is my father's son. Who is he pointing at?
I weigh nothing, but you can still see me. If you put me in a bucket, I make the bucket lighter. What am I?
I have a neck, but no head, and I wear a cap. What am I?
You use a knife to slice my head, Then weep beside me when I’m dead. Who am I?
I get wet while drying. What am I?
The more you take the more you leave behind.  What am I?
I eat, I live. I breathe, I live. I drink, I die. What am I?
I have a single eye but cannot see.  What am I?
I am a seed with three letters in my name. Take away the last two and I still sound the same. What am I?
I am tall when young and short when I am old. What am I?
I go up and never come down.  What am I?
Two horses, swiftest traveling, And harnessed in a pair, Grazing ever in places Distant from them. Who are we?
I am black when you buy me, red when you use me and gray when you throw me away.  What am I?
I go in the water black and come out red.  What am I?
I am heavy forward, but backward I’m not. What am I?
I disappear every time you say my name. What am I?
I fly without wings.  What am I?
I have a face but no eyes, hands but no arms. What am I?
I am an instrument that you can hear but not touch or see.  What am I?
I The more you take away from me, the bigger I shall get. What am I?
If you have me, you want to share me. Once you share me, you won’t have me. What am I?
Tear me off and scratch my head, what once red is now black. What am I?
I am full of holes but still holds water. What am I?
I start with an E, end with an E, and have a letter in me. What am I?
I stink while living but smell good when dead. What am I?
I sit in a corner while traveling around the world. What am I?
My rings are not worth much, but they ell my age. What am I?
If you lose me you may cause people around me to lose me too. What am I?
I am constantly overlooked by everyone but everyone has me. What am I?
I belong to you but others use me more often than you do. What am I?
I must be broken before you can use me. What am I?
I cannot be burned by fire or drowned in water. What am I?
I can fall off a building and live, but put me in water I will die. What am I?
The faster you run, the harder it is to catch me. What am I ??
What can point in every direction but can't reach the destination by itself.
What goes up when the rain comes down?
What do you call two witches who live together?
There are two monkeys on a tree and one jumps off.  Why does the other monkey jump too?
I'm not clothes but I cover your body;The more I'm used, the thinner I grow.What am I?
A wee, wee man, in a red, red coat, A staff in his hand, and a bone in his throat. Who am I?
What is the worst vegetable to have on a ship?
Flat as a leaf, round as a ring; Has two eyes, can't see a thing.What is it?
Why was the picture sent to jail?
Never resting, never still. Moving silently from hill to hill. It does not walk, run or trot, All is cool where it is not. What is it?
It has a long neck, A name of a bird, Feeds on cargo of ships, It's not alive,What is it?
What hired killer never goes to jail?
David’s mother had three children. The first child was named April; the second child was named May. What was the third child’s name?
What falls down but never breaks?
I love to dance and twist and prance, I shake my tail, as away I sail, wingless I fly into the sky.What am I?
What makes a pair of shoes?
A farmer has 17 sheep and all but 9 die. How many are left alive?

Two teams were playing soccer against each other. One player from Team One scored a hat trick (triple goal). Their teammates were very happy. But when he scored the fourth goal,their teammates scolded him instead. How could this be possible?
answer: The player scored an own goal

riddle: What did the scientist get when he crossed a chicken and a cow?
A farmer had twelve prize cows. He arose one morning to find that all but nine of them had been stolen by cattle thieves. How many did he have left?
If you are running a race, and you overtake the person in second place, what place do you move into?
At two letters I am a male, at three I’m the converse. Four letters and I’m male again but greater than of late, At my full length my gender’s changed, but I’m equally as great.
My family is known to be crazy;I am good when I am alone and when spread I am amazing;It's a matter of taste;I am good for your health, bad for your waist.What am I?
A very pretty thing am I, fluttering in the pale-blue sky. Delicate, fragile on the wing, indeed I am a pretty thing. What am I?
Through me you see through things. What am I?
My fleece is white as snow. Everywhere that Mary goes, I go. What am I?
Which of the witch's friends eats the fastest?
Who is next to a king on his throne?
What is bought by the yard and worn by the foot?
Not born, but from a Mother's body drawn, I hang until half of me is gone. I sleep in a cave until I grow old, then valued for my hardened gold. What am I?
What can go up a chimney down, but cannot go down a chimney up?
Black I am and much admired, men seek me until they're tired. When they find me, they break my head, and take from me my resting bed. What am I?
What do angels sing in the shower?
little Nancy Ettistoat, in a white pettiecoat and a red nose, the longer she stands, the shorter she grows!
I go up and down the stairs without moving.What am I?
If a stopper and a bottle cost $2.10 and the bottle costs $2.00 more than the stopper.Then what does the stopper cost?
Blend a teapot shot so the pearlies won't rot!
Runs over fields and woods all day Under the bed at night sits not alone, With long tongue hanging out, Awaiting for a bone. What am I?

Tara has $29.00 dollars. She bought 4 coloring books that cost $3.00 each, 4 boxes of crayola crayons that cost $2.00 each. She spend the rest of her money on markers.How much money did she spend on markers
The letters of the alphabet but only just a few;It's hard to say if I was invented or just discovered by you.What am I?
My tines be long,My tines be short,My tines end ere,My first report.,What am I?
When is a door not a door?
I'm sometimes white, Although sometimes I'm black. I take you there, But never bring you back.What am I?
A nonstop train leaves Moscow for Leningrad at 60 mph. Another nonstop train leaves leningrad for Moscow at 40 mph. How far apartare the trains 1 hour before they pass eachother?
Place three matches on a table. Tell a friend to add two more matches to make eight.
Three matches are sitting on a table. Without adding another make for three matches four. You are not allowed to break any of the matches.
I come across as flat,But theirs more to me than my surface;You climb my moutains from top to bottom,And fall from bottom to top.What am I?
What is the time-piece, That needs no winding?
What do you use to hoe a row, slay a foe, and wring with woe?
What is the only common four-letter English word that ends in the suffix -eny?
At the sound of me, men may dream or stomp their feet at the sound of me, women may laugh or sometimes weep. What am I?
When they are caught, they are thrown away. When they escape, you itch all day. What are they?

I have four of these, With matching extremities. They can do many things, And hardly ever bring me pain. Unless I stick them with a pin, Or burn them sometimes when... What is it that I can wiggle at will? And use in other means still?
A room with no windows or doors Walks in the night, grows in a day, Is found where there is death and decay.
Long and slinky like a trout, never sings till its guts come out.  What is it?
What are the next three letters in this sequence? O T T F F S S
Five creatures cross a field of snow; But leave a single track behind Whose loops and bows are soon, I know, Unravelled by the mind
She wears a blue ring, She wears a grey cloak. She cannot sing her suffering — Her tongue is made of oak
It’s clear these three are brothers For they share a single face. But tell me why they chase each-other Round and round their dwelling place
Tonight at the ball I dance, I dance As well as any you see. Yet nobody takes me by the hand, Or says a word to me.
You are not envious of her, Or so I’m sure you’d say, But tell me why you always wear What she wore yesterday? Who is the mysterious woman?
Evening’s softest blanket’s here And brilliantly white. And yet I pray to God I’m not Enwrapped in it tonight!
When you walk on the living, there’s scarcely a whisper; But walk on the dead, and the crunch is much crisper! The bones you have broken, are strewn in the street, — What lies beneath your feet?

Decipher what each initial stands for.  2 Q in a C
Decipher what each initial stands for.  7 E in the H
Decipher what each initial stands for.  1 H in a D
Decipher what each initial stands for. 16 O in a P
Decipher what each initial stands for.  2 W in a F
What has roots as nobody sees, Is taller than trees, Up, up it goes, And yet never grows?
Thirty white horses on a red hill, First they champ, Then they stamp, Then they stand still.
